snippet: Dr. Rowland’s discovery of the danger to the ozone layer presented by chlorinated fluorocarbons in aerosols was met with disdain, but the research later won him a Nobel Prize.
abstract: F Sherwood Rowland, scientist whose discovery of the danger that aerosols posed to the ozone layer was initially met with disdain but later won him a Nobel Prize in Chemistry, dies at age 84.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Rowland’s discovery of the danger to the ozone layer presented by chlorinated fluorocarbons in aerosols was met with disdain, but the research later won him a Nobel Prize.

headline.seo: F. Sherwood Rowland, 84, Dies; Raised Alarm Over Aerosols
headline.main: F. Sherwood Rowland, Cited Aerosols’ Danger, Is Dead at 84
headline.print_headline: F. Sherwood Rowland, 84, Dies; Cited Aerosols’ Danger
